snippet: The Republicans’ proposed budget partly privatizes Medicare, turns Medicaid into block grants to the states, repeals the Affordable Care Act and reaches balance in 10 years.
abstract: House Republicans will propose 2016 budget that partially privatizes Medicare, turns Medicaid into block grants to states, repeals Affordable Care Act and reaches balance in decade; spending proposal is said to resemble one drafted in 2011 by Rep Paul D Ryan.
lead_paragraph: The Republicans’ proposed budget partly privatizes Medicare, turns Medicaid into block grants to the states, repeals the Affordable Care Act and reaches balance in 10 years.

headline.main: House Republican Budget Overhauls Medicare and Repeals the Health Law
headline.print_headline: House Republican Budget Overhauls Medicare and Repeals the Health Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
